answers.answer: You have a unique set of issues... I suggest you write down &/or check off all your symptoms 1st... My blog has a long list of symptoms... Keep a copy for you and give one to your doctor(s)...~I know you have to keep your progesterone up so you do not abort...~Once all your symptoms, etc... are listed a doctor can better approach managing, etc... all you have wrong to reach your goals...~You may need a naturopathic type doctor as well as the reproductive endo...~I wish you well,ChristiePCOS Lady

question: Diagnosed at Age 15 with PCOS, Recent hormone level tests show Normal Hormone levels with exception to a high testosterone level. Have gone through many treatments, Birth control, diabetes medication, all pills made me sick. I wish to be able to become pregnant, how is it that I can level out my testosterone level enough to possible correct or control the PCOS?
title: PCOS Question
